00015 #include "build_log.h"
00016 
00017 #include <errno.h>
00018 #include <stdio.h>
00019 #include <string.h>
00020 
00021 #include "build.h"
00022 #include "graph.h"
00023 #include "ninja.h"
00024 
00025 // Implementation details:
00026 // Each run's log appends to the log file.
00027 // To load, we run through all log entries in series, throwing away
00028 // older runs.
00029 // Once the number of redundant entries exceeds a threshold, we write
00030 // out a new file and replace the existing one with it.
00031 
00032 namespace {
00033 
00034 const char kFileSignature[] = "# ninja log v2\n";
00035 const int kCurrentVersion = 2;
00036 
00037 }
00038 
00039 BuildLog::BuildLog()
00040   : log_file_(NULL), config_(NULL), needs_recompaction_(false) {}
00041 
00042 bool BuildLog::OpenForWrite(const string& path, string* err) {
00043   if (config_ && config_->dry_run)
00044     return true;  // Do nothing, report success.
00045 
00046   if (needs_recompaction_) {
00047     Close();
00048     if (!Recompact(path, err))
00049       return false;
00050   }
00051 
00052   log_file_ = fopen(path.c_str(), "ab");
00053   if (!log_file_) {
00054     *err = strerror(errno);
00055     return false;
00056   }
00057   setvbuf(log_file_, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
00058 
00059   if (ftell(log_file_) == 0) {
00060     if (fwrite(kFileSignature, sizeof(kFileSignature) - 1, 1, log_file_) < 1) {
00061       *err = strerror(errno);
00062       return false;
00063     }
00064   }
00065 
00066   return true;
00067 }
00068 
00069 void BuildLog::RecordCommand(Edge* edge, int start_time, int end_time) {
00070   if (!log_file_)
00071     return;
00072 
00073   const string command = edge->EvaluateCommand();
00074   for (vector<Node*>::iterator out = edge->outputs_.begin();
00075        out != edge->outputs_.end(); ++out) {
00076     const string& path = (*out)->file_->path_;
00077     Log::iterator i = log_.find(path);
00078     LogEntry* log_entry;
00079     if (i != log_.end()) {
00080       log_entry = i->second;
00081     } else {
00082       log_entry = new LogEntry;
00083       log_.insert(make_pair(path, log_entry));
00084     }
00085     log_entry->output = path;
00086     log_entry->command = command;
00087     log_entry->start_time = start_time;
00088     log_entry->end_time = end_time;
00089 
00090     WriteEntry(log_file_, *log_entry);
00091   }
00092 }
00093 
00094 void BuildLog::Close() {
00095   if (log_file_)
00096     fclose(log_file_);
00097   log_file_ = NULL;
00098 }
00099 
00100 bool BuildLog::Load(const string& path, string* err) {
00101   FILE* file = fopen(path.c_str(), "r");
00102   if (!file) {
00103     if (errno == ENOENT)
00104       return true;
00105     *err = strerror(errno);
00106     return false;
00107   }
00108 
00109   int log_version = 0;
00110   int unique_entry_count = 0;
00111   int total_entry_count = 0;
00112 
00113   char buf[256 << 10];
00114   while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), file)) {
00115     if (!log_version) {
00116       log_version = 1;  // Assume by default.
00117       if (strcmp(buf, kFileSignature) == 0) {
00118         log_version = 2;
00119         continue;
00120       }
00121     }
00122     char* start = buf;
00123     char* end = strchr(start, ' ');
00124     if (!end)
00125       continue;
00126     *end = 0;
00127 
00128     int start_time = 0, end_time = 0;
00129     if (log_version == 1) {
00130       // In v1 we logged how long the command took; we don't use this info.
00131       // int time_ms = atoi(start);
00132       start = end + 1;
00133     } else {
00134       // In v2 we log the start time and the end time.
00135       start_time = atoi(start);
00136       start = end + 1;
00137 
00138       char* end = strchr(start, ' ');
00139       if (!end)
00140         continue;
00141       *end = 0;
00142       end_time = atoi(start);
00143       start = end + 1;
00144     }
00145 
00146     end = strchr(start, ' ');
00147     if (!end)
00148       continue;
00149     string output = string(start, end - start);
00150 
00151     start = end + 1;
00152     end = strchr(start, '\n');
00153     if (!end)
00154       continue;
00155 
00156     LogEntry* entry;
00157     Log::iterator i = log_.find(output);
00158     if (i != log_.end()) {
00159       entry = i->second;
00160     } else {
00161       entry = new LogEntry;
00162       log_.insert(make_pair(output, entry));
00163       ++unique_entry_count;
00164     }
00165     ++total_entry_count;
00166 
00167     entry->output = output;
00168     entry->start_time = start_time;
00169     entry->end_time = end_time;
00170     entry->command = string(start, end - start);
00171   }
00172 
00173   // Decide whether it's time to rebuild the log:
00174   // - if we're upgrading versions
00175   // - if it's getting large
00176   int kMinCompactionEntryCount = 100;
00177   int kCompactionRatio = 3;
00178   if (log_version < kCurrentVersion) {
00179     needs_recompaction_ = true;
00180   } else if (total_entry_count > kMinCompactionEntryCount &&
00181              total_entry_count > unique_entry_count * kCompactionRatio) {
00182     needs_recompaction_ = true;
00183   }
00184 
00185   fclose(file);
00186 
00187   return true;
00188 }
00189 
00190 BuildLog::LogEntry* BuildLog::LookupByOutput(const string& path) {
00191   Log::iterator i = log_.find(path);
00192   if (i != log_.end())
00193     return i->second;
00194   return NULL;
00195 }
00196 
00197 void BuildLog::WriteEntry(FILE* f, const LogEntry& entry) {
00198   fprintf(f, "%d %d %s %s\n",
00199           entry.start_time, entry.end_time,
00200           entry.output.c_str(), entry.command.c_str());
00201 }
00202 
00203 bool BuildLog::Recompact(const string& path, string* err) {
00204   printf("Recompacting log...\n");
00205 
00206   string temp_path = path + ".recompact";
00207   FILE* f = fopen(temp_path.c_str(), "wb");
00208   if (!f) {
00209     *err = strerror(errno);
00210     return false;
00211   }
00212 
00213   if (fwrite(kFileSignature, sizeof(kFileSignature) - 1, 1, f) < 1) {
00214     *err = strerror(errno);
00215     return false;
00216   }
00217 
00218   for (Log::iterator i = log_.begin(); i != log_.end(); ++i) {
00219     WriteEntry(f, *i->second);
00220   }
00221 
00222   fclose(f);
00223   if (unlink(path.c_str()) < 0) {
00224     *err = strerror(errno);
00225     return false;
00226   }
00227 
00228   if (rename(temp_path.c_str(), path.c_str()) < 0) {
00229     *err = strerror(errno);
00230     return false;
00231   }
00232 
00233   return true;
00234 }
